Community Hub
Instinct
Survival has always been tough, but Instinct goes back to the Mesolithic period - around 7000 years ago. You and your companions will have to gather together, collect resources and build/maintain a base for you and your tribe in order to protect each other in the most brutal survival period in history.
User reviews: Mixed (72 reviews) - 45% of the 72 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: Jun 1, 2015
Popular user-defined tags for this product:

Title: Instinct
Genre: Adventure , Massively Multiplayer , Early Access
Release Date: Jun 1, 2015

Visit the website View update history Read related news View discussions Find Community Groups
Share Embed  

Early Access Game

Get instant access and start playing; get involved with this game as it develops.

Note: This Early Access game is not complete and may or may not change further. If you are not excited to play this game in its current state, then you should wait to see if the game progresses further in development. Learn more

What the developers have to say:

Why Early Access?

“We chose the Early Access route for Instinct because we believe that in order to create the perfect survival game, we need to include the community that plays it as much as possible.

Instinct is what we consider to be in a stable early Alpha state, which is ready to play and should be free of game-breaking bugs but is not yet feature complete. We will be using the Early Access platform to implement new features, remove disfavoured ones and balance older features that are already implemented into the game.

If you're interested in a feature complete open world survival game then it's worth waiting and perhaps purchasing Instinct in the future as it is currently not feature complete. If you do purchase Instinct, we do wish for you to bear in mind that it is an Early Access game, so you should expect significant changes to the game over time and anticipate minor bugs.”

Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access?

“Instinct will remain in Early Access until we are satisfied that we no longer have to continue making significant changes to it.

We do not have a specific set date of a full release yet, we wish to take our time during the Early Access phase to utilise community feedback and ensure that everything is balanced and implemented for a reason.”

How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version?

“Early Access is being used to develop, implement and balance game features with the help of community feedback. In the future, when we release the full version of Instinct, players can expect more refined mechanics that have been adjusted to the liking of the community.”

What is the current state of the Early Access version?

“Instinct is what we consider to be in a stable early Alpha state.

Many of the mechanics and features that we have been aiming to include are included in our current version. Please note that game/server wipes may happen throughout the Early Access period - although we will try to keep this to a minimum.”

Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?

“We have no plans to increase the price of Instinct at any point in time.”

How are you planning on involving the Community in your development process?

“We believe that the community will play a significant part in helping us to develop the best survival game we possibly can. We will prioritize features that are more in demand than others - which we will gauge by the community suggestions/feedback that we receive.

Any suggestions will be considered, and we will do our best to answer as many as possible.

You can contact us with suggestions, bugs or any other issues via our Twitter page.”

Recent updates View all (8)

September 30

The future of Instinct.

Since releasing Instinct (IGS2) in June, we have slowly but surely come to notice a limitation in what we're able to do with the time period of the game. We have discussed this on the community hub and some great points have been thrown our way. We have been manoeuvring around the limitations that we have faced with regards to weapons, transport, structures and socialisation as a whole and we feel that after discussions within the team and on the community hub, we're unable to go any further with the current time period and thus we have decided to move the time period of Instinct from Mesolithic/Neolithic to a more recent yet still far from present day 13th century/Medieval setting.

What this update means for Instinct is that we're going to be completely overhauling the game over the indefinite future to match a style of gameplay that we hope can be (and has proven in other games to be) fun and enjoyable. This also means that the entire world has to change, it means we can introduce towns and villages, new weapons and transportation - all of this will take time and a lot of effort. The concept of a survival game based in the stone age is far from dead but we will not be the ones to successfully bring it to light, hopefully someone else will do a far better job than us at that.


IGS4
For us, we're treating this as a new game, we are changing every aspect about Instinct's current build to a more modern and more fun concept. We're creating pretty much everything from scratch - IGS4 will have a whole new 13th century world, new transport, new weapons, new characters & anims, new AI, new UI, etc.

For this reason, it's going to take us time to get out a playable build of the game, we're expecting it to be around December before we get out a build that is fun to play with enough features. The last thing we want to do is go from a game with a lack of features and things to do, and put it into a new game with a lack of features and things to do. We were going to ship a large update for October before working on the new version of Instinct but we have decided to just get IGS4 rolling ASAP and for that reason we have decided to cease further development on IGS2 completely.

We are hoping that our next update will be in December, and will feature a completely different, more fun, enjoyable and feature complete game to what we have now.

And finally..
Since we're not going to be posting updates every month for the next 2/3 months, we will be posting relatively frequent updates with regards to how development is going with IGS4 via Twitter.

Thanks for your patience, and a big thanks to a few users on the community hub that have given us a better view on Instinct's time period, and Instinct as a whole!

8 comments Read more

August 30

Instinct - v1.3 Patch Notes

Instinct - Patch v1.3 - Monday 31st August

[Main]
- The correct redists will now install with the game.
- Added 'Offline Mode' option.
- Added 'LAN Only' option.
- Added 'AI' option.
- Added changeable 'MaxPlayers' option.
- Server browser will now throw an error if no games are available.
- Added option for procgenamount.
- Removed all traces of class specific buffs in code.
- World time is now selectable from options.
- Player will now be redirected to the main menu upon session creation failure. (occurs when there is no connection to Steam)
- Removed horrific spontaneous ragdolls in replace of (slightly) better ones. (They're still far from perfect but we do plan to switch to a death animation/ragdoll combo in 1.4)
- Temporarily disabled location saving.
- Removed Crouch key option whilst crouch is disabled.
- Added camera toggle key option.

[Character]
- Re-implemented Third Person camera mode.
- Removed current position notifier.
- Camera lag.
- Removed current pawn name for owner.
- Added 'freelook' camera to third person view.
- Player now spawns with one torch.

[AI]
- AI can now be turned off completely.
- Added AI despawn system.
- Better AI behaviour. (We're switching to another method of handling AI behaviour in v1.4)
- Added delay on bow AI making it harder for AI to hit players with the bow.
- Handling AI ragdoll skin tone more securely.
- Slightly increased main mid-land AI bounds.
- AI with spawning issues should now completely despawn.

[Systems]
- ProcGen resources can now respawn after 30 minutes of play time.
- Reduced default ProcGenAmount to 650.
- ProcGenAmount is now customisable from the menu.
- Shortened length of all physics on procgen drops.
- Overhauled pick-up system.
- All items have a light to be spotted easier in shadows.
- Campfires should now work without any input issues.

[UI]
- Main Menu overhaul.
- Option menu upon creating a game.
- UI anchoring improvements
- UI positioning fixes.
- Fixed notify bugs in the main menu.

[Audio]
- Added mountain-top soundtrack.
- Added ocean soundtrack.
- Added ambient ocean sounds.
- Added lake soundtrack + ambient sounds.
- Changed main ambient soundtrack.

[Fixed bugs]
- IGS2-0126: Pickup issues
- IGS2-0219: UI overlapping
- IGS2-0019: Issues surrounding player replication at distance
- IGS2-0494: AI standing still
- IGS2-0004: Campfire input issues.
- IGS2-0006: Campfire replication issues.
- IGS2-0502: Collision issues within the world
- IGS2-0540: Fixed AI ragdoll skin tone issues.
- IGS2-0781: Walking backwards whilst bInVanityMode is true.
- IGS2-0481: An issue which resulted in infinite crafting times
- IGS2-0713: AI trembling
- IGS2-0612: Server browser infinite loading time bug
- IGS2-0582: Very rare bug which stopped hunger from decreasing.
- IGS2-0424: Game not launching. (VS redist issues)
- IGS2-0801: Spawning under map.
- IGS2-0923: Torch sprinting issues fixed.
- IGS2-0580: Issues regarding animation replication
- IGS2-0938: Notify pops up in the menu.

Further information:
We switched up our priorities with this patch and decided to focus on giving players more customisation and fixing up bugs that were in the game so that we can proceed without running into a load of bugs in the future.

With this patch we introduced a new options menu upon creating a game which will allow the player to select a maximum player count, whether or not AI should be enabled or disabled, proc gen resource amount and we also included an option for an offline game for players that would prefer a private game. Private offline games are not able to be joined by anyone at the moment, we do plan on creating a method of having private games with passwords etc in the future. For now the best way to play with a select group of friends and ensure no-one else can join is by using the maximum players option and setting it to the amount required.

As requested, we decided to re-implement a third person camera but we added more features to it this time around. The third person mode now has a vanity mode in which you can circle your player, it also has a smooth camera lag and no rotation issues. We also made the ragdolling look far more controlled and less spontaneous which was definitely something we needed to do. The new ragdolling is far from perfect and we are planning on trying out death animations for October but we will have to see how that goes.

From now on our major patches will focus a lot more on implementing new features that will further improve the general gameplay and immersion of Instinct. For this reason we will not be releasing a patch at the end of September and instead in October which should contain a lot of the systems that need a lot of work on along with things like animal AI etc. Also, for the Early Access period, we have decided to significantly lower the price of Instinct for multiple reasons. The main of which is simply to get as many people in the game as possible, after all, if we have more players playing it means we get more feedback and we get to hear what people are looking for. The second being that we felt that the original £9.99 price tag was a bit steep in comparison to where we are in our vision for Instinct, we are getting there but nowhere near completion, yet. Needless to say that we have learnt our lesson and plan on continuing listening to community feedback and working hard towards our final vision of Instinct.

Lastly, we have decided to make a public board for things we're working on implementing for the big October patch which you can find here.

5 comments Read more

About This Game

Instinct is an open-world survival game based in the brutal Mesolithic period which will take your survival skills back to the primary stages, where you will have to face off with the world around you. The Mesolithic era was dark, where the only safety you possessed was within your hands – whether that be in the shape of an axe, or the form of a torch.

Within Instinct, you'll have the opportunity to choose between 5 separate class which give you different buffs and nerfs dependent on the class chosen. You and your companions will be responsible for collecting/farming resources, crafting special items and building up a secure base to protect yourself from the hostile AI that roam the world. With 64 player online/co-op server support, you and up to 63 others can survive within the same harsh environment.

Early Access note: Please do bear in mind that Instinct is an Early Access game, you may encounter minor bugs and incomplete features but no game-breaking bugs should occur whilst playing. Optimisation is an on-going process and players should rely on the recommended specifications in order to persue a smooth playing experience overall.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows Vista/7/8/10 - 32-bit
    • Processor: Intel Core i3 2120 / AMD FX-6300
    • Memory: 3 GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460 / AMD Radeon HD 6850
    • DirectX: Version 11
    • Hard Drive: 2 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: Integrated graphics are not officially supported. They should work but you may run across some issues.
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows Vista/7/8/10 - 64-bit
    • Processor: Intel Core i5 3570k / AMD FX-8350
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660Ti / AMD Radeon HD 7870
    • DirectX: Version 11
    • Hard Drive: 2 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: Integrated graphics are not officially supported. They should work but you may run across some issues.
READ MORE

Early Access Review
Absolutely awful. Constant frame rate issues and could only hit 60fps with everything down to low and resolution scaled to 50%. Settings are awful, not even a sensitivity slider. However the game does have an FOV slider so that's something. Game gives you no tips at all at least in the time I played. Honestly, Bad Rats is a better game than this and it's a much lower price. Go buy Bad Rats please.

Early Access Review

People do a very realistic, but also more realistic than ARK. There are a lot of small animals, although AI is a bit low. Now the game is not very perfect, but I believe that the latter will do better, but I now choose a refund!!!

Lestat2150

122 reviews
Not Recommended
2.5 hrs on record
Posted: June 1
Early Access Review
3 Words: Barren... As... ♥♥♥♥.

The game right now consists of stock Unreal 4 assets and is extremely bare bones. This is a VERY early alpha by the way things look in the game thus far. Animation's are placeholder and are very rough around the edges. Right now, if you want to give the dev's your money for development then throw down your 13 dollars. But with what's in this game right now, I don't think it's worth a buy.

My problem with the marketing of Instinct is the false advertising from the photos on the store front. None of those buildings exist in this early pre-alpha. When I said the game is barren, I literally mean it. You will just see tree's, then a VERY open grass area with nothing. Then another forest in the distance. If you manage to find the ocean you are smacked face first into an invisible wall. Pity too because the water physics and graphics are amazing.

Gameplay consists of walking around with a stamina bar that depletes in about 14 seconds ( like most survival games) and collecting wood and basalt and sometimes a bush or two. I haven't found a way to use the axe that you craft on anything, which is preposterous! So, there is no way to craft anything of value....so what is the point? Can you even call this a survival game? Probably not. Right now, all you do is walk around a forest, then open grass areas, then more forest with stock Unreal 4 asset tree's and bushes. The tree's do look very nice however and I can see some speedtree physics already. A plus side is you can see your characters legs and arms although you have no genitalia.

In 20 minutes I managed to only find 2 pieces of wood and a few other materials. The crafting is just like any other survival game you've ever played. The only differance here are the classes you can pick at the beginning.

It's a shame the dev's couldn't have released a more asset heavy version so we can actually experiment with stuff. Dev's these days just make a bare bones demo and charge money for it. Definately a shame.

YouTube™ Video: FIRST 30 Minutes: INSTINCT - A VERY EARLY ACCESS SURVIVAL TURD 
Views: 1,265
I am being told by some that I am being too harsh on this game on its day one of release. Well the dev's decided to charge $13 for this pre alpha and I'm reviewing it as such.

Ramsickle

Not Recommended

Posted: July 20
Early Access Review
Update: Refund finally came through, so will not be able to update any further than this. Buy at your own risk. This review is for version 1.12

TL;DR Review
Not even a game, barely even a concept. You basically will stare at tree's and nothing else.


Long Review
Where to start, this game, well it cannot even really be called a game, is barren as can be.
The devs state all the basics are in, but if the basics are in I am completely horrified of what it will become if anything.


Let's look at all these basics the game supposedly has.
  • Okay first thing a person usually does in a survival is gather materials for survival, well wander around for an hour and you will be lucky to find even a log, rock, or a bush if that so gathering is basically out of the picture.

  • The building menu doesn't even function and in your inventory there is an option for a foundation, that I spent 15 minutes trying to place before I gave up as it would not place anywhere. There was no other building pieces or options available.

  • The inventory and toolbar, well you cannot even drag things around in there or manually put on or take off the toolbar. Oh which also didn't have a hotkey, had to access inventory to even use items on toolbar then click the use button each time.

  • There is no hunting yet you can be a hunter? Again supposedly the basics are in so I guess that means there will be no hunting, unless they lied and not all basics are in.

  • Farming, same as above, doesn't exist but can be a farmer. Also again, remember the basics are already in so I guess this won't be coming either, unless they lied and not all basics are in.

  • No real food gathering source at all in fact really except a couple berries you start off with, chances of finding anything else are really non-existant.

  • The gamechanging AI! Since they seem to bring this up as such a great thing. First AI was a bunch of men (literally copy and pasted models of yourself) standing in front of TeePees, these were the aggressive AI. The AI took a swing at me, then did nothing, I punched it (or slapped it maybe? Couldn't tell with the animation being displayed) and it never retaliated, so I continued until it died. It instantly respawned in same spot and still never hit me again after the first hit.

  • Roaming AI. Well this AI roams, in an obvious predetermined path that is extremely small and never attack. Also copy and pasted models with nothing added.

  • AI death animation, well it looks similar to this before falling into a ball:
    YouTube™ Video: Family guy Wacky waving inflatable arm flaling tube man 
    Views: 687,314
    Waking waving arm iflateable tUbe man
    and a real picture for comparison:
    Pro physics 10/10 would not buy again. 
    A Screenshot of Instinct
    By: Ramsickle
    Eerily similar right?!?!

  • Voice Chat, the game cut off me and my friends microphone from Steam chat stating it was in use by the game, which has no option to talk to each other in. Yup.

I made the mistake of ignoring the negative reviews I saw since people said a new patch was out and it was much better since those reviews, I gave that the benefit of the doubt since I've seen that happen before, boy do I wish I had listened to the negative reviews this time around.

There is no way I can give this a positive review, there is nothing there, barely even a vision of a game currently. Developers stated basics were already implemented but seems a lot of basics you would expect are not there, it doesn't even really have any concept of survival either. You will spend your time wandering around, there is literally nothing else to do.
